question: An accurate clock shows 8 o'clock in the morning. Through how many degrees will the hour hand rotate when the clock shows 2 o'clock in the afternoon?
solution: Angle traced by the hour hand in 6 hours = (360 × 6)° = 180°.

question: The reflex angle between the hands of a clock at 10.25 is:
solution:
Angle traced by the hour hand in 125 hrs = (360 × 125)° = 312.5°.

Angle traced by the minute hand in 25 min = (360 × 25)° = 150°.

Reflex angle = 360° - (312.5° - 150°) = 360° - 162.5° = 197.5°.

question: A clock is started at noon. By 10 minutes past 5, the hour hand has turned through:
solution:
Angle traced by the hour hand in 12 hrs = 360°.

Angle traced by the hour hand in 5 hrs 10 min. i.e., 31 hrs = (360 × 31)° = 155°.

question: A watch which gains 5 seconds in 3 minutes was set right at 7 a.m. In the afternoon of the same day, when the watch indicated quarter past 4 o'clock, the true time is:
solution:
Time from 7 a.m. to 4.15 p.m. = 9 hrs 15 min. = (37/4) hrs.

3 min. 5 sec. of this clock = 3 min. of the correct clock.

(37/4) hrs of this clock = (1/20) hrs of the correct clock.

(37/4) hrs of this clock = (720 × 37/4) hrs of the correct clock.

= 9 hrs of the correct clock.

The correct time is 9 hrs after 7 a.m. i.e., 4 p.m.

question: How much does a watch lose per day if its hands coincide every 64 minutes?
solution:
55 min. spaces are covered in 60 min.

60 min. spaces are covered in (60 × 60) min = 65 5 min.

Loss in 64 min. = (65 5 - 64) = 16 min.

Loss in 24 hrs = (16 × 1 × 24 × 60) min = 32 min.

type: type-4-time when hands are in straight line but not together
question: At what time between 7 and 8 o'clock will the hands of a clock be in the same straight line but not together?
solution:
When the hands of the clock are in the same straight line but not together, they are 30 minute spaces apart.

At 7 o'clock, they are 25 min. spaces apart.

The minute hand will have to gain only 5 min. spaces.

55 min. spaces are gained in 60 min.

5 min. spaces are gained in (60 × 5) min = 5 5 min.

The required time is 5 5 min. past 7.

type: type-3-time when hands are at right angles
question: At what time between 5.30 and 6 will the hands of a clock be at right angles?
solution:
At 5 o'clock, the hands are 25 min. spaces apart.

To be at right angles and that too between 5.30 and 6, the minute hand has to gain (25 + 15) = 40 min. spaces.

55 min. spaces are gained in 60 min.

40 min. spaces are gained in (60 × 40) min = 43 7 min.

The required time is 43 7 min. past 5.

question: At what angle, the hands of a clock are inclined at 15 minutes past 5?

question: At 3:40, the hour hand and the minute hand of a clock form an angle of:
solution:

Angle traced by it in 11 hrs = (360 × 11)° = 110°.

3

question: How many times are the hands of a clock at right angles in a day?
solution:
In 12 hours, they are at right angles 22 times.

In 24 hours, they are at right angles 44 times.

The hands of a clock are at right angles 22 times in a day.

question: The angle between the minute hand and the hour hand of a clock when the time is 8.30 is:
solution:

2

Angle traced by the minute hand in 30 min. = (360 × 30)° = 180°.

60

Required angle = (255 - 180)° = 75°.

question: How many times in a day, are the hands of a clock in a straight line but opposite in direction?
solution:
The hands of a clock point in opposite directions (in the same straight line) 11 times in every 12 hours. (Because between 5 and 7 they point in opposite directions at 6 o'clock only).

So, in a day, the hands point in opposite directions 22 times.

question: At what time between 4 and 5 o'clock will the hands of a watch point in opposite directions?
solution:
At 4 o'clock, the hands of the watch are 20 min. spaces apart.

To be in opposite directions, they must be 30 min. spaces apart.

The minute hand will have to gain 50 min. spaces.

55 min. spaces are gained in 60 min.

50 min. spaces are gained in (60 × 50) min = 54 6 min.

The required time is 54 6 min. past 4.

question: At what time between 9 and 10 o'clock will the hands of a watch be together?
solution:
To be together between 9 and 10 o'clock, the minute hand has to gain 45 min. spaces.

55 min. spaces are gained in 60 min.

45 min. spaces are gained in (60 × 45) min or 49 1 min.

The hands are together at 49 1 min. past 9.

question: At what time, in minutes, between 3 o'clock and 4 o'clock, will the needles coincide with each other?
solution:
At 3 o'clock, the minute hand is 15 min. spaces apart from the hour hand.

To be coincident, it must gain 15 min. spaces.

55 min. are gained in 60 min.

15 min. are gained in (60 × 15) min = 16 4 min.

The hands are coincident at 16 4 min. past 3.

question: How many times in a day are the hands of a clock straight?
solution:
In 12 hours, the hands coincide or are in the opposite direction 22 times.

In 24 hours, the hands coincide or are in the opposite direction 44 times a day.

question: A watch which gains uniformly is 2 minutes low at noon on Monday and is 4 min. 48 sec fast at 2 p.m. on the following Monday. When was it correct?
solution:
Time from 12 p.m. on Monday to 2 p.m. on the following Monday = 7 days 2 hours = 170 hours.

The watch gains (2 + 4 4) min. or 34 min. in 170 hrs.

Now, 34 min. are gained in 170 hrs.

2 min. are gained in (170 × 5 × 2) hrs = 50 hrs.

The watch is correct 2 days 2 hrs. after 12 p.m. on Monday, i.e., it will be correct at 2 p.m. on Wednesday.
